meanings.definition: Lacking grace or ease of movement; awkward or clumsy.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was ungainlier than the older dogs at the park.
meanings.sent2: Her ungainlier dance moves made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent3: The ungainlier squirrel tried to climb the tree but kept slipping down.
meanings.sent4: His ungainlier attempts at juggling the balls ended in a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The ungainlier swan stumbled on the uneven ground, drawing attention from passersby.

meanings.definition: Not attractive or pleasing in appearance; unattractive.
meanings.sent1: The old, ungainlier building stood out among the modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent2: She felt ungainlier in the outdated dress compared to her friends.
meanings.sent3: The ungainlier painting in the gallery seemed to be mocking the elegant ones around it.
meanings.sent4: The ungainlier flower in the garden wilted sadly, unnoticed by most visitors.
meanings.sent5: The ungainlier statue in the park was often overlooked by tourists in favor of the more beautiful ones.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of skill or ability; inept.
meanings.sent1: His ungainlier attempts at fixing the leak only made it worse.
meanings.sent2: The ungainlier chef struggled to create a dish that pleased the customers.
meanings.sent3: The ungainlier magician's tricks always ended in laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her ungainlier driving skills led to a few close calls on the road.
meanings.sent5: The ungainlier student stumbled through the presentation, forgetting key points along the way.
